name: Greene.io
tagline: Personal site of James M. Greene
body: # James M. Greene [][me/gh] [][me/t] [][me/email] [][me/site] --- ### Technical Prowess - I am a JavaScript language expert, for both the frontend (browsers) and back (Node.js, PhantomJS, etc.). Check out my [open source work][cover-letter/open-source] and my [best project narrative][cover-letter/best-project] for more details. - I am extremely proficient at learning new programming languages and frameworks. - I am a practitioner of unit testing, though I know from experience that it doesn't always pan out as well we hope. - I am a regular GitHub.com user but I accomplish most of my Git interactions from the terminal. - I am extraordinarily detail-oriented. ### Personality - I am an easy-going person and enjoy working with others, though I have also been an "individual contributor" for much of my professional career. - I have experience leading small teams (1-10 devs) on focused features/refactors/projects. - I refuse to stop [learning][cover-letter/learning], and I strive to find a healthy balance between the breadth and depth of the knowledge that I absorb. - I am very passionate about creating _and shipping_ high quality software; a desire which is complemented well by my detail-oriented nature. - I am _obsessed_ with the three Cs of open source: [creating, contributing, and consuming][cover-letter/open-source]. - I have an unabashed love for JavaScript that most engineers consider unhealthy. --- ### _More about me!_ - I :gift_heart: Open Sourcing: [OPEN-SOURCE.md][cover-letter/open-source] - I :heart: Learning: [LEARNING.md][cover-letter/learning] - I am very proud of a particular project: [BEST-PROJECT.md][cover-letter/best-project] - I am considered a JavaScript expert by my peers and current employer - I may have an emoji addiction :blush: [me/gh]: http://github.com/JamesMGreene "GitHub" [me/t]: http://twitter.com/_JamesMGreene "Twitter" [me/email]: mailto:james.m.greene@gmail.com "Email" [me/site]: http://greene.io/ "Website" [cover-letter/open-source]: OPEN-SOURCE.md [cover-letter/learning]: LEARNING.md [cover-letter/best-project]: BEST-PROJECT.md
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
